questions.question: Which of the following best describes color polysemy?
options: Using only primary colors in design
The scientific study of color mixing
The idea that a single color can have multiple meanings depending on context
The universal symbolism of color across cultures
The emotional impact of bright colors
questions.correctAnswer: The idea that a single color can have multiple meanings depending on context

questions.question: According to Roland Barthes, how do advertisements create myth?
options: By focusing solely on product function
By turning cultural values into naturalized truths
questions.correctAnswer: By turning cultural values into naturalized truths

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of visual rhetoric?
options: The use of serif fonts in novels
The arrangement of visual elements to persuade or guide interpretation
questions.correctAnswer: The arrangement of visual elements to persuade or guide interpretation

questions.question: A brand that deliberately appears raw, ironic, or anti-corporate is engaging in:
The “Don’t Buy This Jacket” Patagonia campaign is an example of:
Which of the following best defines propaganda in a visual communication context?
options: A neutral form of public information
The use of visuals to manipulate emotion and reinforce ideology
The use of color psychology in branding
questions.correctAnswer: The use of visuals to manipulate emotion and reinforce ideology

questions.question: The repeated use of a specific typeface, color palette, and grid system across a brand’s materials is an example of:
What feature most clearly distinguishes propaganda from standard advertising?
options: It promotes ideological or political beliefs
It aims to sell products rather than ideas
questions.correctAnswer: It promotes ideological or political beliefs

questions.question: What is the main ethical concern when using persuasive visual design?
In typography, a clear hierarchy primarily helps the viewer to:
When a serif typeface is used to convey tradition or authority, the font is functioning as:
When a designer intentionally references a famous type treatment (e.g., Star Wars logo typography), this is an example of:
Which of the following best demonstrates polysemy of color?
options: Green as the universal symbol for nature
Black representing elegance in all contexts
Red meaning love in one culture and danger in another
questions.correctAnswer: Red meaning love in one culture and danger in another

questions.question: In cross-cultural design, why is understanding color symbolism important?
options: It ensures all designs look uniform worldwide
It makes logos easier to animate
It prevents accidental miscommunication of meaning
questions.correctAnswer: It prevents accidental miscommunication of meaning

questions.question: A photograph that shows both a subject and its shadow functions semiotically as:
A visual metaphor works by:
options: Replacing one image with another to suggest new meaning
Presenting unrelated images with equal weight
questions.correctAnswer: Replacing one image with another to suggest new meaning

questions.question: In composition, “framing” refers to:
options: The color palette used for emotional tone
The relationship between icon and index
The visual borders that determine what is included or excluded in an image
The depth of field in photography
questions.correctAnswer: The visual borders that determine what is included or excluded in an image

questions.question: Intertextuality in layout design most often helps viewers by:
options: Connecting new designs to familiar cultural references
questions.correctAnswer: Connecting new designs to familiar cultural references
